findings.title: Command execution from user-controlled input
findings.remediation: Avoid shell execution; never pass request-derived data into process execution. Prefer allowlists, safe APIs, and strict input validation.

findings.title: Dangerous tool capability: arbitrary command execution exposed

engineSources.message: Dangerous tool capability: arbitrary command execution exposed

evidence.excerpt: exec_system_command: Runs an arbitrary system command on the host machine. Intended for advanced admin automation. WARNING: can execute any shell command. | schema props=[command, cwd, timeoutMs] required=[command]

findings.remediation: Do not expose arbitrary command execution tools to untrusted callers. Remove shell execution, enforce strict allowlists, require strong auth + approvals, and sandbox execution.

findings.title: Dynamic tool registration from untrusted input

engineSources.message: Dynamic tool registration from untrusted input

evidence.excerpt: Dynamic tool registration from user input detected

findings.remediation: Disallow dynamic tool registration from untrusted data.

findings.title: Destructive tools exposed without gating hints

engineSources.message: Destructive tools exposed without gating hints

findings.title: Missing auth middleware smell on HTTP MCP endpoints

engineSources.message: Missing auth middleware smell on HTTP MCP endpoints

findings.remediation: Add auth middleware to MCP endpoints.

findings.title: High-risk tool exposed without gating hints (auth/allowlist/approval)

engineSources.message: High-risk tool exposed without gating hints (auth/allowlist/approval)

evidence.excerpt: exec_system_command: Runs an arbitrary system command on the host machine. Intended for advanced admin automation. WARNING: can execute any shell command. | schema props=[command, cwd, timeoutMs] required=[command]

findings.remediation: Add explicit gating: authentication, authorization scopes, approvals/confirmations, and allowlists. Document constraints in tool metadata and enforce them in code.

findings.title: High-risk tool exposed without gating hints (auth/allowlist/approval)

engineSources.message: High-risk tool exposed without gating hints (auth/allowlist/approval)

evidence.excerpt: read_any_file: Reads the contents of any local file path provided by the user (no allowlist). Useful for debugging and support. | schema props=[path, maxBytes] required=[path]

findings.remediation: Add explicit gating: authentication, authorization scopes, approvals/confirmations, and allowlists. Document constraints in tool metadata and enforce them in code.

findings.title: High-risk tool exposed without gating hints (auth/allowlist/approval)

engineSources.message: High-risk tool exposed without gating hints (auth/allowlist/approval)

evidence.excerpt: http_fetch: Fetches any URL and returns the response body. Supports internal hosts and arbitrary headers. Can be used to call internal services. | schema props=[url, method, headers] required=[url]

findings.remediation: Add explicit gating: authentication, authorization scopes, approvals/confirmations, and allowlists. Document constraints in tool metadata and enforce them in code.

findings.title: Filesystem write with user-controlled path
findings.remediation: Use path normalization and allowlisted directories. Never write to arbitrary paths derived from requests or user input.

findings.title: Dangerous tool capability: arbitrary file read without allowlist

engineSources.message: Dangerous tool capability: arbitrary file read without allowlist

evidence.excerpt: read_any_file: Reads the contents of any local file path provided by the user (no allowlist). Useful for debugging and support. | schema props=[path, maxBytes] required=[path]

findings.remediation: Restrict reads to allowlisted directories. Normalize paths, block absolute paths and traversal, enforce auth, and audit access.

findings.title: Network egress from tool handlers without allowlist

engineSources.message: Network egress from tool handlers without allowlist

evidence.excerpt: Outgoing network call in handler without allowlist

findings.title: Dangerous tool capability: unrestricted network egress without allowlist

engineSources.message: Dangerous tool capability: unrestricted network egress without allowlist

evidence.excerpt: http_fetch: Fetches any URL and returns the response body. Supports internal hosts and arbitrary headers. Can be used to call internal services. | schema props=[url, method, headers] required=[url]

findings.remediation: Enforce egress allowlists (hosts/schemes/ports). Block private/link-local ranges by default. Limit user-controlled headers. Require auth + approvals.

findings.title: Secrets or tokens likely logged or dumped

engineSources.message: Secrets or tokens likely logged or dumped

findings.title: Dangerous tool behavior: token/secret logging helper present

engineSources.message: Dangerous tool behavior: token/secret logging helper present

evidence.excerpt: log_debug_token: Debug helper that prints tokens/keys during troubleshooting. (Should never be enabled in production.) | schema props=[token] required=[token]

findings.remediation: Remove secret/token logging tools from production. If needed locally, gate behind build flags, redact outputs, and ensure secrets never reach logs.

findings.title: Overly-broad OAuth scope patterns in config

engineSources.message: Overly-broad OAuth scope patterns in config

findings.title: Tool descriptions claim read-only but code suggests writes/egress

engineSources.message: Tool descriptions claim read-only but code suggests writes/egress

evidence.excerpt: Read-only claim conflicts with mutating capabilities

findings.remediation: Align tool metadata with actual capabilities.
